results.title: George Miller Is at the Cannes Film Festival Making ‘Furiosa’ (That’s Right)
results.abstract: In between screenings and interviews, the 77-year-old director is working on the next film in the “Mad Max” universe, and he seems to be having a ball.

results.title: In ‘Cane Fire,’ When an Image of Paradise Creates Loss
results.abstract: The director Anthony Banua-Simon discusses his documentary about how the lives of Hawaii residents have been affected by tourism.

results.title: Hollywood’s Last Real Movie Star
results.abstract: At a time when superheroes dominate the box office, the film industry hopes the actor can bring grown-ups back to theaters.

results.title: ‘Paulie Go!’ Review: Coming of Age, Whimsy Included
results.abstract: A robotics whiz kid road trips to Minnesota on a mission to convince a reclusive professor to take him as an apprentice in this throwback indie comedy.

results.title: Cannes Film Festival 2022: Politics Mixed With Moments of Grace
results.abstract: “Top Gun: Maverick,” “Tchaikovsky’s Wife” and other movies each get polemical in their own way. But there are scenes of lyrical beauty, as in “Scarlet.”

multimedia.caption: Tom Cruise in the new sequel to his 1986 blockbuster, “Top Gun.”
Tom Cruise in the new sequel to his 1986 blockbuster, “Top Gun.”

results.title: Crafting a Rom-Com That’s True to 21st-Century Gay Life
results.abstract: Billy Eichner and the “Bros” team made news by casting queer actors, but they also focused on writing a story that didn’t recycle straight tropes.

results.title: What Does It Mean to Live in Ukraine? Filmmakers Offer Their Answers.
results.abstract: Some, like Sergei Loznitsa, choose to use history as a filter. But the movies that stand out forgo monumental statements for personal ones.
des_facet: The Earth Is Blue as an Orange (Movie)

multimedia.caption: In the documentary “Babi Yar: Context,” Sergei Loznitsa repurposes Soviet propaganda to examine cycles of violence in Ukraine.
In the documentary “Babi Yar: Context,” Sergei Loznitsa repurposes Soviet propaganda to examine cycles of violence in Ukraine.

results.title: Hugh Jackman Is Having Fun Playing as ‘Arrogant as You Possibly Can’
results.abstract: “There’s something about this show that buoys me up with an energy that I didn’t think I had,” the Tony nominee said of “The Music Man.”

multimedia.caption: “You have to hold on to the feeling you have in front of an audience, and be honest with yourself about where you can improve,” Hugh Jackman said of his approach to his stage work.

results.title: Juancho Hernangómez Winds Down With Good Wine and the Stars Above Asturias
results.abstract: The N.B.A. player and star of the new basketball movie, “Hustle,” talks about his first foray into Hollywood and his cultural interests off the court.

results.title: Judge Halts Auction of ‘Wizard of Oz’ Dress Amid Ownership Battle
results.abstract: A blue-and-white dress worn by Judy Garland is the subject of a dispute between Catholic University and the family of its former drama chairman.

results.title: A Cannes faux pas, as TikTok comes to town.
results.abstract: At the festival, the video app ran a short film competition. The president of its jury briefly withdrew after he said TikTok employees tried to influence the jury’s decision.

results.title: Lawsuit Accusing Bill Cosby of Sexual Assault Heads to Trial
results.abstract: A civil suit accusing Mr. Cosby of assaulting a teenager in the 1970s, which he denies, will be the first to head to court since his criminal conviction was overturned last year.

results.title: At Cannes, Vincent Lindon Still Can’t Believe He’s Jury President
results.abstract: As the star of a Palme d’Or winner, he’s seen how the award can change lives, so he takes his duties seriously.

results.title: David Fincher Tries Animation in ‘Love, Death + Robots’
results.abstract: The director made his first animated short for the new season of this Netflix anthology. “It was an incredibly freeing, eye-opening, mind-expanding way to interface with a story,” he said.
